clinical_study.official_title: Ultrasound Guided Arterial Puncture: a Prospective, Blinded, Randomised Controlled Trial.

brief_summary.textblock: The main purpose of the study is to evaluate whether the routine use of ultrasound guided arterial puncture can increase the proportion of patients who only needs one puncture attempt in order to successfully extract enough blood to make an arterial blood gas analysis, when ultrasound guided arterial puncture is compared to conventional arterial puncture technique.

primary_outcome.measure: The proportion of patients who only needs one puncture attempt in order to successfully extract enough blood to make an arterial blood gas analysis
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 1 hour after arterial puncture

secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 1 hour after arterial puncture
up to 1 hour after arterial puncture
secondary_outcome.description: Patient corporation is subjectively estimated by the physician performing the arterial puncture. The degree of patient corporation are assessed on a scale from 1 - 5, where 1 is very poor patient corporation and 5 is perfect patient corporation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain Scores on the Visual Analog Scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 1 hour after arterial puncture

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of attempts before successfully acquiring arterial puncture
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 1 hour after arterial puncture

arm_group.description: Patients randomised to the this arm has arterial puncture performed using simultaneously ultrasound in order to guide the passage of the syringe from the patient's skin to the artery
Patients randomised to the active comparator arm has arterial puncture performed using the conventional technique

intervention.description: Arterial puncture is performed using simultaneously ultrasound in order to guide the passage of the syringe from the patient's skin to the artery
Arterial puncture is performed using the conventional technique

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient admitted or treated in the acute emergency department
- Indication for a arterial blood gas analysis, according to the physician responsible for the patient's hospital stay / treatment
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient age < 16 years
